historical:
Effect of Amendments

D.C. Law 18-223 rewrote the section, which had read as follows:

"The Commissioner may establish continuing education requirements for resident insurance producers."

Emergency Act Amendments

For temporary (90 day) amendment of section, see § 2166(d) of Fiscal Year 2011 Budget Support Emergency Act of 2010 (D.C. Act 18-463, July 2, 2010, 57 DCR 6542).

Legislative History of Laws

For Law 17-155, see notes following § 31-1131.02.

For Law 18-223, see notes following § 31-101.

DC CODE § 31-1131.07b

Current through December 11, 2012

sections.text: A title insurance producer shall fulfill the following continuing education requirements:
Eight hours per year, of which not more than 4 hours may be completed by computer or video-based education; or
If the title insurance producer is an attorney, 4 hours per year in courses related to real estate and continuing education courses approved by the Commissioner by rule.
The Commissioner may establish continuing education requirements for resident insurance producers.
